v - t - e The **2009 Southeast Asian haze** was an episode of large scale [air pollution](/wiki/Air_pollution) primarily caused by [slash and burn](/wiki/Slash_and_burn) practices used to clear land for agricultural purposes in [Sumatra](/wiki/Sumatra), [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia). It affected the areas surrounding the [Straits of Malacca](/wiki/Straits_of_Malacca) which besides Indonesia include [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) and [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The haze began in early June 2009 and progressively became worse toward July. With a prevailing dry season caused by [El Nino](/wiki/El_Nino), burning and hence the haze was expected to continue until August or September when the [monsoon](/wiki/Monsoon) season arrived. ## Malaysia ### Air Pollution Index Daily average API readings in June 2009 Date[George Town](/wiki/George_Town,_Penang)[Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur)[Malacca Town](/wiki/Malacca_Town)[Johor Bahru](/wiki/Johor_Bahru)[Kuantan](/wiki/Kuantan)[Kuching](/wiki/Kuching)1Unavailable57514165292407352464139331734738432743946313344355344445344135640404747432875876514039288306760544736928985656523110376758525345114069654548301235108635541281330804441465114206453514731152056404038371634514248492217446153424434185558493644391962514959424620686147414236 0-50 Good 51-100 Moderate 101-200 Unhealthy 201-300 Very unhealthy 301- Hazardous - [2006 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2006_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2013 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2013_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2015 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2015_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [ASEAN Agreement on Transboundary Haze Pollution](/wiki/ASEAN_Agreement_on_Transboundary_Haze_Pollution)
